subtitle: Can I drink liqueur?
description: Liqueur is harmful to you and your baby
title: Can I drink liqueur?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

It is better not to drink liqueur while you are pregnant, and also while you are breastfeeding. This will keep your baby safe and healthy. 

A small amount of liqueur is usually safe, and if you had a small amount of alcohol before you knew you were pregnant, do not worry. But it is best not to drink any liqueur while you are pregnant. 

Here’s why. Liqueur is a harmful substance. When you drink alcohol, it rapidly reaches your baby via your bloodstream. Heavy drinking can cause pregnancy loss and premature birth. Too much liqueur can even increase the risk of your baby being stillborn.

If you drink too much liqueur during pregnancy, it can damage your developing baby's cells forever. This could affect how your baby's face, organs and brain grow.

Remember that traditional medicines from the market often contain liqueur So they are not good for you at all! They are bad for you and your baby, so do not use them.
